title: Potential Buffer Overflow in StringCchCopy
description: The function StringCchCopy is used to copy strings, but it does not check if the destination buffer size is sufficient. This can lead to a buffer overflow if the source string is longer than the destination buffer.
fix: Ensure that the destination buffer size is checked before using StringCchCopy. Alternatively, consider using safer functions like std::wstring::copy or std::wstring::assign.
